name: 3×8-to-12 Incremental Progression
time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~30-45s + 2 rests x ~90-120s = ~5 min total
overview_and_execution: Perform 3 sets of 8 with a weight you can handle for 10–12 reps in good form. If you complete all sets, progress to 3×10 next session, then 3×12. Once you can do 3×12, add 5–10 lbs and return to 3×8. If you fail to hit the reps, use a plateau strategy (retry, add a fourth set, swap exercises, or move to another rep scheme).
example_application: Week 1: 3×8 with 50 lb DBs. Week 2: 3×10 with 50s. Week 3: 3×12 with 50s. Week 4: Increase to 55 lb DBs and return to 3×8.
important_notes: Start with a weight you can do 10–12 reps with perfect form. If stalled, apply a plateau strategy or switch movements/loading schemes.
volume_metrics: 3–4 sets of 8–12 reps, typically 24–36 total reps per session per exercise
